Reviews.Title: “Outdated and poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: motohachi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Only good thing is that he room is huge and the staff are friendly. Carpet was really old and dirty. They said we can use internet in the room, but hardly any signal. While we're in the elevator, the elevator got stuck. There seems to be some lobby renovation going on, but the contractors are constantly smoking in the lobby so very bad air. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dale D
Reviews.Content: The hotel san francisco was situated so perfectly at the heart of a great city. The hotel is only a 2 star at best but the location was so perfect that not much time was spent in the room itself but out in the areas surrounding the hotel. The price for the room was also a good drawing point and the staff spoke very good English, and helped me to find everything that I needed. Many good restaurants near the hotel and good access to the subway system which will take you anywhere in the city that you wish to go. I would stay here again without a worry. Well done San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Takes some getting used to”
Reviews.Author: Clairie2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on pre tour accommodation before joining our group tour. The hotel is a great location - right across the street from Alameda Central Park where there are markets galore. The rooms themselves are clean, but security seems to be a little bit of a problem. The door on our room clearly showed that people had busted through at some point, and this was a bit worrying at first. However, we had no problems with theft etc, and by the 3 days staying at this hotel, it was like normal. As a precaution though, we used the hotel's safety security boxes for passports and extra cash etc. It is good, they have 1 key, you get the other and the box cannot be opened without both keys. Service from the front counter is quite poor - however if you meet Ruben, he was absolutely lovely and tried to help us with everything that we asked about. The restaurant food is good, and we had a few meals. They also have free wifi - you just need a password that they give you at checkin. Other downfalls of the hotel, is that it is quite dated and rooms do not have air conditioning or fans, and it can be quite noisy if you have a room facing the street. Our room faced onto the street, where the pub on the corner and the building across the road played extremely loud music for hours on end.

Reviews.Title: “Location amazing - hotel alright”
Reviews.Author: MistOll
Reviews.Content: The first thing is location - it is simply perfect. With a room on the 14th floor, we had a great view over the city. The price is excellent for the location. However, the hotel itself is quite run down and hasn't been very well looked after. The food at the restaurant isn't too great and the room itself wasn't the cleanest. Having said that, the beds were comfortable with clean sheets and the bathroom was good enough. The staff are also very helpful and polite. All in all, it is great for the money but it is far from luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “lock up your stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Helen1107
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in February as part of a group tour around Mexico...we absolutely loved mexico city and this hotel is in a great location, so dont want to be too melodramatic about our stay here - however i thought it was worth letting people know that on our first afternoon in the Hotel San Francisco our room got robbed! Literally 45 minutes after checking in! We got to the room, left our bags, went out to have a wander around the area and when we returned the lock had been broken and some of our stuff gone. The hotel management were somewhat helpful - they apologised and moved us to a much nicer room, but think it was pretty likely that someone in the hotel was responsible! The hotel is in a good area - convenient for walking everywhere, and is pretty cheap - but the rooms are pretty barren and i would encourage anyone staying there to make sure all their valuables are locked away!

Reviews.Title: “Bad first night”
Reviews.Author: June84StAlbans
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here it was my first night in Mexico. The road was being dug up at the timeand so was very noisy and dusty. But, the staff were fantastic, very helpful and friendly and a l;evel of service which wa sbetter than most of it's size. Don't reccommend staying more than one night but it was clean and possibly a lot more enjoyable once the building work is completed

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a really bad shape”
Reviews.Author: alex_tripper
Reviews.Content: I went with my family last December to spend new year's eve and even though at the beginning the staff is very friendly , once you are there they never attend your needs. The mattress was very hard and uncomfortable, the pillows are a joke: really small and thick m the noise from outside is not filtrated and the worse thing was that the window didn't close properly and we were at the 8th floor! I got sick because of this bad-shaped window. I constantly reported all this and they only said yes but didn't solve anything. Don't waste your money on this hotel. There are better ones for a better price, and also don't exchange pesos to dollars, the change rate is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Pailin9
Reviews.Content: I traveled with one of my friends to Mexico City in November of 2009. This was my third visit to Mexico City and I knew that I wanted to stay near Alameda Central because it is my favorite place. This hotel was the cheapest available with a location near to Alameda Central and so we decided to take our chances. We had a perfect stay! We travelled from the airport by metro stop Hildalgo. From there it was a short walk through the park to the hotel. The hotel is tall and labelled well so that we could find it very easily. The room was spotless clean and very simple. The television had one English station. The shower was amazing....BIG, clean, with nice tiles. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. They helped us find and book day-tours. When I left my bag of souvenirs on one of the tour buses, they called the driver and tracked it down. They appreciated the little Spanish I tried to speak and sort of 'adopted us'...always looking out for our needs. I read reviews that mentioned the tour groups. We did see that, but the tour groups were handled very efficiently. We would look in the lobby and it would be packed with the tour group, but as soon as we walked up to the counter, we got big smiles and fast service. The hotel is just feet away from the park. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. On Sunday it was fun to see all the bikes going by. I can't stress enough that location was perfect. .....and as cheap as it was...it's a steal! I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: zodiac6573
Reviews.Content: It's hard writing a review for this hotel as I've never stayed elsewhere in Mexico City. On the plus side, the location is great, the staff are friendly and helpful, the rates are great and the area is quiet. However the beds were hard, the rooms could be cold and they are also very basic. I will recommend this place though because the pluses do outweigh the minuses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TeresaNL
Reviews.Content: I visit Mexico City several times a year on business, and have stayed here several times. The location couldn't be better, it is close to lots of public transportation, in a very safe area, near a large park/garden, with many reasonably priced restaurants nearby, as well as bookstores, coffee(!) drugstores, pretty much anything you need is within walking distance. The hotel is not fancy, but it clean and well-mantained. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They maintain a couple of private taxi drivers who will come and pick you up anywhere at the time and place you specify and don't charge extra for picking you up no matter when or where. (Ask for Pepe or Jorge). There is a very nice restaurant downstairs with mid-range prices, good service. The only downside is that the TV's don't work that well, but I don't watch much TV so didn't really. The cost can't be beat for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As It May Seem”
Reviews.Author: glbetrkkr
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers of this hotel, you get what you pay for. I really don't have any qualms with this hotel. It's quite basic, but for $40 it's what I would expect. The staff were quite helpful, though, in arranging cabs and informing us of what to do/see around the area. The Palace of Fine Arts is located only two blocks away. There is a park across the street. Would I stay here again? Probably not since I enjoyed the neighbourhoods of Reforma much better. Nonetheless, if you're looking to save money, I would recommend the San Francisco Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and without class”
Reviews.Author: cement2009
Reviews.Content: If I'd known that this hotel was full of tour parties and had whitewashed walls, I'd have paid a little extra and gone anywhere else. Reception is constantly busy, but its mainly because of large groups forever checking in and out. The rooms are particularly dull and staff seem to lack any kind of courteous behaviour. "Get them in, get them out" seems to be the attitude here. When I arrived back in Mexico City, I booked in elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Real Cheap, Real Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Stuba
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay for the price. It is an older hotel, but the room was clean every morning, the front desk staff went way out of their way to help me find things to do while I was there. The restaurant staff looked like they needed a break, because they looked like it was such a burden to serve you food. The front desk staff were polite, friendly, hilariously funny, and good people. The hotel is located about a block away from the Palacio de Bellas Artes, and maybe five blocks from the Zocalo. It is an excellent location. On many nights, I went walking downtown by myself, and nothing happened. I felt very safe. About a block away is the SEARS building, and if you go inside, and take the elevator to the 8th floor, there is a coffee shop with a balcony, and you can sip your latte and see the entire city. Overall, wonderfull experience at Hotel San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest decent hotel in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: jcs27
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Francisco is a good value in Mexico City, but you should be aware that it has some problems. The main reason to choose Hotel San Francisco is cost. You can get a room with two full-size beds for just $40, by taking advantage of discounts that are perpetually available through Otel, Expedia, CheapTickets, and other sites. You cannot get this rate by showing up without a reservation -- the normal rate is about $70. If you can't get a room at a discount rate, don't bother -- there are better hotels in Mexico City. The rooms seem to be in various states of remodeling -- I've had some nice rooms in this hotel, and some rooms where everything was stained and cracked. All of them were acceptable. The hotel is on a side street, a five-minute walk from the metro, the Palacio of Bellas Artes, and the edge of the Centro Historico shopping area. The safety of the neighborhood is acceptable, but there are plenty of safer places to stay in Mexico City. (Go just a few blocks north of the hotel, and you'll be in the rough Col. Guerrero/La Laguanilla district -- not a safe place to be at night at all.) The biggest problem with this hotel is all the construction in the neighborhood. The 1985 earthquake damaged or destroyed most of the buildings on the block where the hotel sits. The hotel was repaired and opened after about a year, but the building next door was razed and is only recently being reconstructed. Construction is loud, dusty, and begins early in the morning. At times, the street in front of the hotel is closed, and taxis must drop you a block away. Every once in a while, something happens to the sewer, and horrible-smelling sewer gas enters the rooms through the drains. The construction probably explains why this decent hotel in a safe neighborhood is so cheap. The rooms in this hotel are constructed in a more "closed", carpted, sterile modern style, rather than in the traditional "open", tiled, ventilated Mexican style. This helps cut down on the construction noise, but you can still loudly hear it in the morning. You might ask for a room not facing the construction. Beware that this hotel may have security and theft problems. The rooms do not have card-key locks like newer hotels have. On a recent stay, hundreds of dollars worth of silver was stolen from a friend's room. This wasn't enough to deter me from staying there again, because I carry nothing valuable, and every cheap hotel in Mexico City potentially has theft problems; however, be sure that you lock anything of value in the hotel safe. Interestingly enough, Hotel Del Angel and Suites Del Angel are owned by the same management company as this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel - TONS of construction in area though”
Reviews.Author: hejsan
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a vacation. The hotel is decent, although not overly impressive. The staff when we checked in were kind of rude, but the other staff in hotel were better for the remainder of our stay. The rooms were very clean and seem to have been recently painted. The bed was comfortable and we had a decent view, although the hotel is in the middle of a huge constuction project - it will be great in about 6 months when its done, but for now its kindof like living in an obstacle course as the streets are all dug up and detoured in neighborhood. Due to construction it was really noisy - clearly not the hotels fault. Also it was pretty hot in Mexico theis past week so the room was pretty hot at times and the first fan they gave us din't work well - they were nice abot replacing it with one that worked. Leaving the window open at night brought in uninvited guests - mosquitos so we learned to deal with the rom being kind of warm. Anyway, the place is decent - we got a great price for it through Hotwire and it is well located and provides a decent level of basic services.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: krasiCanada
Reviews.Content: It was OK. Not very clean, but with exelent location. Most of the guests at the hotel are mexican, but the staff is frendly. And the price is very good.

Reviews.Title: “the good outweighed the bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All in all, it was an okay stay. Besides discovering a cockroach or two in the lobby of my floor, and the elevator malfunctioning, it was a good stay. The staff was friendly and ready to help 24 hours a day if I had a problem. The food was interesting-- I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “umm.....”
Reviews.Author: curleytop06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, there were a few problems as an American going here and then to a better hotel, but we came back later in the week. My problem was with the breakfast, things that were supposed to be warm were cold and those that were supposed to be cold was warm... the people were nice, but we got stuck in the elevator twice when it broke down. But the sites around and the city was well worth the little inconvienences.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest staff for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Mexico City is this older hotel in which there is a wonderful staff. The waiters smile and remember your name. The bell boys go out of their way to help. The desk staff are frinedly and work hard to make your stay pleasant. The hotel is quaint. The food is good. The service is better. I have stayed there two times and will again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the most horrible places I stayed at. This is one of the worse in Mexico City (DF), I found hair in my bad, towels and shower were dirty

HotelInfo.Name: San Francisco Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Luis Moya No 11 | Colonia Centro, Mexico City 06050, Mexico
